repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
As suggested in my comment (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32162#issuecomment-2767527469) on #32162, this PR implements a ok/warn/error summary in the section header of
health checks.

The format needs discussion.

## Example Formats

![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9d3fb216-9f31-41b2-a730-802fef6cf60a)

| Description | Screenshot |
|--------|--------|
| | ![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/26d59f31-1010-4d62-8924-7b7413f9341b) |
| Without alignment | ![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5457d9d9-6ed2-438c-998a-2a842fc14f9c) |
| With alignment | ![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/be958168-276d-4ea4-80cd-b7a3a45769ca) |
| `‚ùå:1` | ![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d2f08e82-cbc4-4ae7-947c-d1e3655da9f9) |
| w/o emojis (can ofc be colored) | ![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2968f7f4-abb5-4c49-8dd3-377548676b80) |
| w/o emojis and space | ![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3159eb19-45f5-4f1e-82a1-aa2964f485e5) |
| `E:1` | ![](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abcbec54-f43c-4c29-bc07-b7534a874b77) |

## Statusline default formats

Here are some defaults formats that different statusline plugins use. They mostly use (nerdfont) symbols instead of the diagnostic letters:

- Lualine: `E 3 W 2 I 1`
- Galaxyline: `I 1 W 2 E 3`
- Neoline: `E 3 W 2 I 1`
- Mini-statusline: `E3 W2 I1`
- Bufferline: `3E 2W 1I`
- sttusline: `E 3 W 2 I 1`
- hardline: `E:3 W:2 I:1`
- statusline.lua: `I 1 W 2 E 3`

---

Problem:
As checkhealth grows, it is increasingly hard to quickly glance through the information.

Solution:
A summary listing the number of ok, warn, and error outputs per section can aid the user in finding warnings or errors.

comment_data.body: probably shouldn't show warn/error icon unless they are >0
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -420,10 +425,15 @@ function M._check(mods, plugin_names)
       M.error('The healthcheck report for "' .. name .. '" plugin is empty.')
     end
 
+    local report = ('%2d ‚úÖ %2d ‚ö†Ô∏è %2d ‚ùå'):format(

comment_data.body:
Not sure of the best name for this, but `report_output` seems strange.
```suggestion
local results = {} ---@type { ['ok']: number, ['warn']: number, ['error']: number }
```
and I don't think we need to show the number of of OKs in the header; those (numbers) are not very useful.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -420,10 +425,15 @@ function M._check(mods, plugin_names)
       M.error('The healthcheck report for "' .. name .. '" plugin is empty.')
     end
 
+    local report = ('%2d ‚úÖ %2d ‚ö†Ô∏è %2d ‚ùå'):format(

comment_data.body: Isn't 'results' a bit vague? Maybe check_summary, msg_counts, check_counts?
This can also be done implicit (if it's `nil` that means there are no messages of that type). Thus `or 0` and `> 0` can be removed. What is preferred?

@@ -341,6 +345,22 @@ M._complete = function()
   return rv
 end
 
+local function build_summary()
+  local s = ''
+  local errors = report_output['error'] or 0
+  local warns = report_output['warn'] or 0
+  local oks = report_output['ok'] or 0

+  -- s = s .. (warns > 0 and (' %d W'):format(warns) or '')
+  -- s = s .. (oks > 0 and (' %d O'):format(oks) or '')
+  s = s .. (errors > 0 and ('%d ‚ùå'):format(errors) or '')
+  s = s .. (warns > 0 and (' %d ‚ö†Ô∏è'):format(warns) or '')
+  s = s .. (oks > 0 and (' %d ‚úÖ'):format(oks) or '')

@@ -341,6 +345,22 @@ M._complete = function()
   return rv
 end
 
+local function build_summary()
+  local s = ''
+  local errors = report_output['error'] or 0
+  local warns = report_output['warn'] or 0
+  local oks = report_output['ok'] or 0
+

+  -- s = s .. (warns > 0 and (' %d W'):format(warns) or '')
+  -- s = s .. (oks > 0 and (' %d O'):format(oks) or '')

comment_data.body: showing green checks gives a warm fuzzy feeling.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
--- Gets the results heading for the current report section.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -341,6 +346,23 @@ M._complete = function()
   return rv
 end
 
+--- Build the summary with diagnostic counts.
+--- For displaying in the header.

comment_data.body: this is redundant with line 422. Looks like line 425 is also redundant...

wouldn't need the `@type` if you define the table here. also eliminates the `or 0` in `M.ok()` etc.

```suggestion
local check_summary = {
  ok = 0,
  ...
}
```

comment_regular_data.body:
I really like this idea. Screenshot? :)

Ideally it should not take up any extra vertical space. Instead, smush it into the existing title for each section. If we need to drop the currently RHS text we can consider that.

To be honest, not a fan of the emojis. Can't we hook into the general diagnostic signs (defaulting to `E: W: H:`)?

(Fan of the feature in general, though!)
Alternatively, why not make these diagnostics, period? So you can show them in the status bar, get signs, navigation etc. for free!

> Alternatively, why not make these diagnostics,

That can be a followup, but doesn't need to block this.

Screenshots added! Can add more examples of different configurations if necessary. 

> If we need to drop the currently RHS text we can consider that.

That seems like the best option to me. It doesn't give much more information than the title on the left.

> To be honest, not a fan of the emojis. Can't we hook into the general diagnostic signs (defaulting to E: W: H:)?

TBH, I'm also not a fan of the emojis and would also prefer to use the default signs, or `vim.diagnostic.config().signs.text`.

> Alternatively, why not make these diagnostics, period? So you can show them in the status bar, get signs, navigation etc. for free!

I like this idea, but I'm not sure how that'll work out. If I were to get error signs somewhere in my checkhealth output, I would think there is an error in the health check, not that it's just reporting errors. But as justinmk said, this could be a follow up. The current implementation is a fairly lightweight change for now.

I went with the format `‚ùå 3 ‚ö†Ô∏è 2 ‚úÖ 1` where elements that appear 0 times are left out. I've also incorporated it in the tests. This looks like this (when checks are folded):

![Example of new summary](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a8af11dd-bf4a-4849-90f6-d56d2425dacb)

Let me know if you prefer a different format.

> lose the OK summary; they don't provide useful information 

It provides "positive confirmation", i.e. it gives the user confidence that things were actually checked. And it gives a warm fuzzy feeling. It's harmless at worst, and increases confidence at best.

Just to propose yet another possible format, that might be a compromise between showing and not showing the ok-count: showing a single ‚úÖ if there are no errors or warnings:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/244a1f25-04fe-4179-83f3-5c62fc796c64)

I also think I prefer `2 ‚ö†Ô∏è 1 ‚ùå` more than the other way around. We read LTR and this reads like '2 warnings, 1 error' instead of 'warnings, 2, error, 1'.

Backport failed for `release-0.11`, because it was unable to cherry-pick the commit(s).

Please cherry-pick the changes locally and resolve any conflicts.
```bash
git fetch origin release-0.11
git worktree add -d .worktree/backport-33388-to-release-0.11 origin/release-0.11
cd .worktree/backport-33388-to-release-0.11
git switch --create backport-33388-to-release-0.11
git cherry-pick -x 5a94edad70f9c47250fa53dd73cf30f191a3cd49
```
